citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
Three adult domestic pigs undergoing anesthesia did not have blood pressure monitoring as specified in their assigned
Protocol 222. The IACUC functions to review all details and use of animals to ensure their health and well-being. The
IACUC did not approve this significant change in care and use of animals in ongoing activities. Unapproved changes in
the protocol can be detrimental to animal health, because it could result in a failure to recognize and address pain and
distress in animals. The IACUC must review and approve proposed significant changes regarding the care and use of
animals in ongoing activities.
Correct by 7 April 2023.

A developed contingency plan was not available at time of inspection. Contingency plans help prepare facilities on how to
provide humane handling of animals during emergent events. The registrant must develop a complete contingency plan
tailored to the facility and animals on hand. All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this
plan and the facility must maintain documentation thereof.
Correct by 24 April 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Tamila Stott, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.31(c)(7) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
Three adult domestic pigs undergoing anesthesia did not have blood pressure monitoring as specified in their assigned 
Protocol 222.  The IACUC functions to review all details and use of animals to ensure their health and well-being.  The 
IACUC did not approve this significant change in care and use of animals in ongoing activities.  Unapproved changes in 
the protocol can be detrimental to animal health, because it could result in a failure to recognize and address pain and 
distress in animals.  The IACUC must review and approve proposed significant changes regarding the care and use of 
animals in ongoing activities. 
Correct by 7 April 2023. 
2.38(l)(1) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
A developed contingency plan was not available at time of inspection. Contingency plans help prepare facilities on how to 
provide humane handling of animals during emergent events. The registrant must develop a complete contingency plan 
tailored to the facility and animals on hand.  All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within this 
plan and the facility must maintain documentation thereof. 
Correct by 24 April 2023.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Tamila Stott, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
